info.name: Olfactory bulb
info.description: The olfactory bulb is the expanded rostral end of the olfactory tract.  It is located in the frontal cranial fossa directly above the cribriform plate. It receives olfactory input from the very thin axons (Cranial Nerve I) of receptor neurons in the olfactory epithelium of the nasal cavity. It projects via the olfactory tract to olfactory (piriform) cerebral cortex as well as the amygdala.
